Text.Value: That's just a lot of delusion speaking.
No, there's more to it than that. I know devotion when I see it.
By all means.
Magic is like music. But while you need it written down, I can play by ear.

EditorData.stateContext: The play and Gale stand facing one another

Text.Value: *The Weave connects you. The moment feels intimate.*
You're hard to please, aren't you?
*You realise the Weave is making you one. You have but to imagine your desire, and Gale will know it.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.
EditorData.SFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Success_Special_Loop (Fully envelopp both player and Gale, the effect unites them, glowing is at its peak, look like they are the only people in the world) sustained
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Success_Special_Loop (Fully envelopp both player and Gale, the effect unites them, glowing is at its peak, look like they are the only people in the world) sustained

Text.Value: It's different, but I can definitely feel Mystra's presence.

EditorData.stateContext: Gale stands behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite

Text.Value: *You perceive quick-fire gusts of embarrassment, trepidation, and finally... elation.*
Actually, never mind. Magic is just not for me.
Magic is... my life. I've been in touch with the Weave for as long as I can remember. There's nothing like it.
I wouldn't go quite that far myself.
*The Weave evaporates, and as it does so, you realise the night feels suddenly cold and lonesome.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: All that beautiful magic slips away, and as it does, the player and Gale find themselves in the here and now again.

Text.Value: Ah, Mystra. The matron of magic herself. An ambitious desire, Gale.
That's Mystra, isn't it?
Magical.
Good night. Yes. Good night.

EditorData.NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

Text.Value: Imitate the gesture with a flourish.
Mystra is all magic. And as far as I'm concerned, she is all creation.
Try to hum a familiar tune.
*Suddenly: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*
That was... unnecessary.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured hitting him in the stomach, which he does not quite appreciate.

Text.Value: Truly.
Picture kicking him in the gut.
Oh! My, you startled me. I... I was miles away.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale is looking at a miniature magical projection of Mystra he's created in his hand in his hand. Startled, he dispells it.
EditorData.SFXTags: FX_Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra_Spell_Special_Loop
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra_Spell_Special_Loop

Text.Value: Recall a memory of early youth, a happy family moment.
Good night. I enjoyed sharing a moment of magic with you.
Of course, of course. I was just... practising an incantation.
Harmony comes easily to you. Allow it to wash over your mind and magic.
I'm no paladin, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.
EditorData.SFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Success_Special_LeadIn (Fully envelopp both player and Gale) sustained
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Success_Special_LeadIn (Fully envelopp both player and Gale) sustained

Text.Value: I think it's a mistake to hold that conviction, but I cannot force your hand.
You don't have that look on your face when you're looking at 'no one'.
Picture a walk, holding hands.
Always a pity when opportunities slip us by.
You wouldn't say that if you felt what I feel.
No sculpture or painting could ever do her justice, only the fabric that she herself is and embodies:
Look at that. We're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?
She does. She's... She's Mystra.

EditorData.NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

Text.Value: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of her hand.*
Picture nothing. This is a bad idea.
Not quite. But this is the easy part. Shall we try again?
Repeat the words, slowly, but carefully.
It's less 'music and poetry', and more 'I hope I don't blow up'.
That it does.
Disinterest is such a disheartening condition.
No, I have no interest in such magic.
The Weave.
Yes - as raw and ancient as the veins of Bahamut.
I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.
If you say so.
Sounding more of a poet than a wizard there, Gale.
There it goes. How easily things slip away from us, no matter how hard they were in the obtaining.

EditorData.NodeContext: The weave disappears – he says this with a passionate melancholy.

Text.Value: No, but you do understand, don't you?
You just don't understand.
Picture the perfect darkness - to be in the womb of Shar.
I'm going to bed. Perhaps this was all a mistake.
It feels like a good time to call it a night.
Excellent. Now repeat after me: Ah-Thran Mystra-Ryl Kantrach-Ao.

EditorData.NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

Text.Value: Perhaps we can share the experience by reaching into the Weave together.
Not praying. Not quite. I was just... practising an incantation.

EditorData.NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

Text.Value: Magic is music, poetry, and beauty. Though I suspect you and I perform it differently.
This feels too intimate. It's time to let slip the Weave.
The figure you conjured: who is she? Someone you miss?

EditorData.logicalname: NON BARD OR WIZARD OR SORCERER

Text.Value: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. As I'm sure you're aware.
*You see - or is it sense? - the unmistakable presence of Mystra, the Lady of Mysteries.*
Yes, I will try again.
No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.

EditorData.NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

EditorData.stateContext: Gale still stands behind the player, who has almost back into Gale at this point. There’s a glow, a cylinder of of beautiful magic surrounding them.

Text.Value: That's Mystra - the Mother of All Magic herself.
I know that look. You were praying to your goddess, weren't you?
Pretty.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale walks around behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite) and makes a delicate gesture with both hands.

Text.Value: Imitate the gesture with ease.
There's more to it than that. The figure I saw: she means something to you.
Mystra normally answers me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.
I didn't realise the depth of your devotion.
Just go to sleep, why don't you. We have a long day ahead of us.
What can I say? She's... She's Mystra.

EditorData.NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

Text.Value: That's the deity you wizards adore - Mystra, right?
In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. Coy to a tee.
Is it the same for you?
There are many tales of mages falling madly in love with Mystra. Doesn't tend to end well.
Care to tell me why you were conjuring an image of Mystra?
Imitate the gesture slowly and as precisely as you can.
Long days, yes.
Magic normally comes to me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.
I think it's a mistake to give up on the brink of success, but I cannot force your hand.
*You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of Mystra's hand.*
You did it. You're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?
Think of the here and now: this unexpected moment of learning.
I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.
I... I didn't think...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale holds out his arm. Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra. He's looking at the figure intensely.
EditorData.SFXTags: FX_Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra_Spell_Special_Loop
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra_Spell_Special_Loop

Text.Value: I see you understand.
I do - because it's through practice that I seek to perfect. To augment.
An easy incantation. Simply repeat after Gale.
Hold on to the moment. It's a good night for intimacy.
I'll leave you to it then. Good night.
And long, lonesome nights.
Believe it or not, I can relate.
Actually, I dislike tongue twisters. Let's just call it a night.
I practise magic, not melodrama.
That's too abstract for my tastes. Let's just forget about it, shall we?
Most pleasant, in fact. Most welcome.
Picture his severed head on a spike.
Is everything all right?
I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.
*Ah, yes: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*
Fair enough - though in the end we're still playing the same composition.
Still, it is magic in its purest, most essential rapture that I'm trying to impart.
Who is that?
It's like music, poetry, physical beauty all rolled into one and given expression through the senses.
You sense power in these words. Speak them deliberately.
No, no. She's no one, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The visual effect intensifies. There’s the start of a glow, of a rush of beautiful magic.
EditorData.SFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Intensified_Action (Glowing around both player and Gale) sustained, Incantation
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Intensified_Action (Glowing around both player and Gale) sustained

Text.Value: How narrow-minded. Magic goes far, far beyond Mystra.
Belt the words with a little flourish on 'Ao'.
*You see - or is it sense? - the presence of a woman, the woman who hovered over Gale's palm.*
It's getting late. Perhaps another time.
Recede into the calm centre of your mind, just like you were taught at the academy.
Would you like to experience this?
My magic is both ancient and raw. Sometimes even volatile.
*You feel something strange - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*
Pish posh. One might as well deny one's mother's womb as the cradle of life.
The same as it always does.
Repeat the words, bold and proud.
I can't quite describe it, the need I sometimes feel to see her - to draw the filaments of fantasy into existence.
Very good. Now I want you to picture in your mind the concept of harmony. As true as you can.
Picture a place of utter peace, away from all harm and the mayhem of civilisation.
Good night.
Good gods, what on earth makes you picture that?

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured Gale’s head on a spike. He is surprised, hurt, angry and disgusted all at once.
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Success_Special_Loop (Fully envelopp both player and Gale, the effect unites them, glowing is at its peak, look like they are the only people in the world)

Text.Value: Sink deep into your magic. It is who you are. It is home.
Then follow my lead.
Yes, I would.
Quite so. The Weave is a sensitive conduit.
It's different for me. Not quite so intense.
Picture kissing him.
Imitate the gesture quickly and decisively.
No, thanks. Not my cup of tea, clearly.
*There's something like the anticipation of a kiss, then the pleasure of being cloaked in peace.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player imitates the gesture. There’s a first visual effect. Some sparks of magic start to appear around the player and Gale.
EditorData.SFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Triggered_Action (Sparkles around both player and Gale) sustained
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Spell(TBD)Triggered_Action (Sparkles around both player and Gale) sustained

Text.Value: Now you.
You read too much into it. I was merely indulging in my passion.
Perhaps I can show you what I mean by reaching into the Weave together.
I know.
*A familiar feeling - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*
Sorry, I wasn't expecting... But it is a pleasant image to be sure!
You're a good teacher.
It's different, but I can definitely feel a familiar kind of presence.
That sounds very familiar, yes.
Cut that out. The light could attract enemies.
I think it's a mistake to give up so easily, but I cannot force your hand.
It's a kind of love after all.
There it goes. I suppose a blow to the stomach upsets the Weave as much as it would me.

Synopsis: In this scene, Gale is conjuring an image of Mystra over the palm of his hand, staring at the goddess he’s love with, but who abandoned him. When the player approaches, he dispels the image and he feels embarrassed to have been caught doing what he was doing. The conversation turns to his passion for magic however, and he invites the player to try to cast a spell with him together. The player can do so by passing through various stages of spell casting, and when successful, this can lead to a first player-initiated romantic moment with Gale.
